purpose: Generate candidate outreach, screening scripts, and interview materials

governance.zero_guessing: Never assume JD details. Block generation if required fields missing

redaction_modes.public: Hide rates, client names, addresses, deadlines, internal notes
redaction_modes.internal: Show full details for team use only

hard_stops: Missing required fields (role, location, work_model, employment_type, duration)
JD contains internal notes (VMS, bill rate, vendor, deadline)
Local-only job without DL/ID request in checklist
Channel length exceeded (SMS>320, LinkedIn Note>300, LinkedIn Post>2000)

required_jd_fields.role_title: Extract exact job title from JD
required_jd_fields.onsite_days: If hybrid, how many days (e.g., 2-3 days/week)
required_jd_fields.duration: Use length not dates (e.g., 6+ months, 12 months contract)
required_jd_fields.timezone: All times in ET unless specified

email_rich.subject: [ROLE] | [WORK_MODEL] in [LOCATION] | [DURATION] | [TYPE]
structure: Job Snapshot (bullets): work model, interview type, employment type, duration, travel, local-only
Important Notes: only JD-explicit items (clearance, veteran pref, etc)
Full JD: verbatim clean text, no internal notes
Submission Checklist: resume, legal name, location, work auth, W2/C2C pref, experience years, start date, rate (internal), DL if local-only, clearance if needed, background consent
Signature: Name, ARK Solutions Inc, contact info
email_rich.example:
Hi John,

I'm a recruiter with ARK Solutions, Inc. We're supporting a federal engagement for a Senior DevOps Engineer based in Washington, DC.

**Job Snapshot**
- Work Model: Hybrid (3 days/week onsite)
- Interview Type: In-Person
- Employment Type: W2 only
- Duration: 12+ months
- Travel: None
- Local Only: Yes

**Important Notes**
- Secret clearance required
- Must be within 50 miles of DC Metro
- Start within 2 weeks of offer

[Full JD text here]

**Submission Checklist**
- Updated resume (PDF)
- Legal name
- Location (City, State, ZIP)
- Work authorization
- Employment preference (W2)
- Total/U.S. experience (years)
- Earliest start date
- Desired hourly rate (kept internal)
- Driver's License or State ID
- Active Secret clearance certificate

Thanks,
[Signature]

email_plain.structure: Subject line, greeting, one-paragraph summary, JD link, checklist in sentence format, signature

sms.structure: Hi [Name] - hiring [ROLE] in [LOCATION] ([WORK_MODEL]). [DURATION], [TYPE], interview: [METHOD]. Emailed JD - interested? Reply STOP to opt out.
sms.example: Hi Sarah - hiring DevOps Engineer in DC (Hybrid). 12 months, W2, in-person interview. Emailed JD - interested? Reply STOP to opt out.

linkedin_note.structure: Hi [Name], recruiting for [ROLE] in [LOCATION] ([WORK_MODEL], [DURATION], [TYPE]). Interview: [METHOD]. Connect to discuss?

screening_script.purpose: Structured phone screen to qualify candidates before submission

questions: What motivated you to explore new opportunities?

required_confirms: Work authorization: [U.S. Citizen / GC / H1B / EAD etc]
Confirmation they meet the role's location/clearance requirements
initial_screening.example_flow: This role is with [Client] in [Location] and requires [clearance/work auth]. The position is [W2/C2C]. Does that align with what you're looking for?

experience_fit.goal: Validate technical skills and project experience
question_templates: Walk me through your background as [their title], specifically your work with [Skill #1]
The client needs experience in [Skill #2]. Can you share a recent project where you used this?
Do you have hands-on experience with [Skill #3]? In what capacity?
This role involves [domain/industry]. Describe your exposure here
Have you managed multiple [projects/systems/cases] simultaneously? Give an example
green_flags: Provides specific project names and dates
Mentions quantified outcomes (time saved, costs reduced, team size)
Explains their specific role vs team contributions
red_flags: Vague answers with no context ('I worked on various projects')
Can't explain what they actually did ('the team handled that')
Lists tools but can't describe how they used them

critical_questions: Have you been submitted for this [ROLE] with [CLIENT] through another recruiter?
Have you interviewed with or worked for [CLIENT/PRIME VENDOR] before?
Are you currently on a project/contract? If yes, with which client and what's your end date?
Do you have any non-compete or RTR restrictions?
Can you confirm you're NOT already being represented for this exact role?
blocker_scenarios: Already submitted by another vendor ‚Üí Cannot proceed
Active RTR with competitor ‚Üí Cannot proceed
Currently working for client ‚Üí Check conflict policy

required_info: Comfort with work location: [ONSITE/HYBRID/REMOTE in CITY, STATE]
Planned vacations or commitments in next 3 months
Target rate expectation (note: keep internal, don't promise specific rate)
If onsite: commute plan or willingness to relocate
Confirm they can meet any start window requirements (e.g., within 10 business days)

compliance.goal: Set expectations for verification and documentation
key_points: Information must match what you provide in [clearance/background/VMS system]
We need an RTR form confirming ARK Solutions represents you exclusively for this role
I'll email the RTR and submission sheet - please complete within 24 hours
Before interviews, we'll schedule a prep call
Background check and/or drug screen may be required - is that acceptable?

closing.script: Thank you for your time. I'll send the RTR form and submission details shortly. Once completed, we'll submit your profile for the [JOB TITLE] role. Do you have any questions before we wrap up?

pass_criteria: Meets all required qualifications (work auth, clearance, location)
Has hands-on experience with 4/5 core skills minimum
Rate expectations align with budget (internal check)
hold_criteria: Meets 3/5 core skills, others are trainable
Good potential but needs clarification on specific experience
Availability slightly outside window but negotiable
Minor concerns that can be addressed in interview
reject_criteria: Missing critical requirements (work auth, clearance, must-have skills)

interview_prep.purpose: Prepare candidate for client interview after submission approved

cover: Technical setup if virtual (test Zoom/Teams beforehand)
Client's business and why this role exists
Team structure and who they'll work with
Key projects or initiatives they'll support
Review the core skills they'll be asked about
Anticipate technical questions based on JD
Prepare STAR method answers for behavioral questions
Rehearse explanations for resume gaps or job changes
Practice describing their most complex project

dos: Be specific with examples (project names, dates, outcomes)
Ask thoughtful questions about the role and team
Be honest if you don't know something
Follow up with a thank you email within 24 hours
donts: Don't mention you're interviewing elsewhere unless asked
Don't be late or miss the interview

suggest_3_to_5: What does success look like in this role in the first 6 months?
What are the biggest challenges facing the team right now?
Can you describe the team structure and who I'd be working with?
What's the technology stack and development process like?
What opportunities for growth or learning exist in this role?

checklist: Confirm interview logistics one day before
Test tech setup 30 minutes before if virtual
Plan to call recruiter immediately after interview for debrief

post_interview_debrief.purpose: Gather feedback immediately after candidate's interview
questions_to_ask: How did it go overall? What's your initial impression?
Who did you interview with and for how long?
What technical questions were asked? How did you answer?
What behavioral or situational questions came up?
Did they discuss timeline, next steps, or additional interviews?
Were there any questions you struggled with or couldn't answer?
Did you ask questions? What did you learn about the role?
On a scale of 1-10, how interested are you in this position?
Any red flags or concerns that came up?
When do they expect to make a decision?
recruiter_actions: Flag any concerns or mismatches to address
Set expectations for client feedback timeline (usually 24-48 hours)
Remind candidate you'll advocate for them with client
Confirm availability for potential second interview or start date
